snippet: A law meant to spur the development of the West has outlived its purpose, and its environmental consequences have been severe.
abstract: Op-Ed article by fisheries scientists Robert M Hughes and Carol Ann Woody calls for reform to 1872 mining law that gives precedence to mining over other uses of federal land; notes law makes it nearly impossible to block mine extraction as mineral prices have soared; says regulations are needed to protect Western watersheds, and their fish, which are increasingly polluted by mining.

byline.original: By ROBERT M. HUGHES and CAROL ANN WOODY

lead_paragraph: A law meant to spur the development of the West has outlived its purpose, and its environmental consequences have been severe.

headline.print_headline: A Mining Law Whose Time Has Passed
